description.hltext_display: Look for Shares of NASDAQ OMX to Potentially Pullback after Yesterday's 2.85% Rise (NDAQ)
description.content:
NASDAQ OMX (NASDAQ:NDAQ) traded in a range yesterday that spanned from a low of $23.42 to a high of $24.34. Yesterday, the shares gained 2.85%, which took the trading range above the 3-day high of $24.18 on volume of 3.3 million shares. Often times after large one-day gains, short term traders will seek to take profits and, as such, investors should be cautious.
Shares of NASDAQ OMX are currently trading above their 50-day moving average (MA) of $21.62 and above their 200-day MA of $20.15. Look for the MA to provide support for a short-term pullback in the shares.
SmarTrend currently has shares of NASDAQ OMX in an Uptrend and issued the Uptrend alert on September 14, 2010 at $19.41. The stock has risen 21% since the Uptrend alert was issued.
SmarTrend expects the share price to pullback toward the $24.16 support level. Afterwards, we expect it to move upward with its peers in the SmarTrend Stock Exchanges industry.
Keywords: nasdaq omx trading range stock news

description.hltext_display: Frank Mulligan: Sleigh bells ring, should you be listening?
description.author: GateHouse Media, Inc
description.content:
The disturbing images, graphic depictions of street life, and psychologically hurtful barbs that masquerade as music assail our young people from all directions.
I’m writing, of course, about Christmas carols.
Sure, they seem innocent enough.
But so do pine needles until they clog up the free flow of rainwater though your gutters and cause the very foundation of the home you worked so hard to share with the bank to crack, leaving you to fend for survival on the streets, vying with stray dogs for the offal left in refuse dumpsters behind abandoned mill buildings.
So how do pine needles look now?
It only takes a little digging beneath the surface to excavate the potential harm to the young and impressionable posed by the lyrics to many Christmas “classics.”
Take “Santa Claus is coming to Town,” for just one example.
It opens thus:
“You better watch out
You better not cry
Better not pout
I’m telling you why
Santa Claus is coming to town.”
OK, let’s threaten children with some unstated retribution for being honest with their emotions. Sure, that’s a sound psychological practice.
Then there are these lines:
“He’s making a list
And checking it twice
Gonna find out who’s naughty and nice
Santa Claus is coming to town.”
This is clearly an incitement to paranoia, as well as an indictment of big government and its ability to manipulate our lives that’s clearly too sophisticated for the innocent mind of a small child.
But that’s not enough cognitive pressure to apply to the delicate psyche of a developing mind.
No, there’s more:
“He sees you when you’re sleeping
He knows when you’re awake
He knows if you’ve been bad or good
So be good for goodness sake.”
OK, now you’re telling a child that privacy is illusory, that some all-seeing, maniacal old man is peering at them while they are slumbering in utter vulnerability. They are also left with the morally ambiguous message that they should be “good” to avoid retaliation from a guy who’s probably standing over them the minute they drift off to sleep, brandishing weaponry that can only be imagined.
The “song” closes with a repetition of the opening lines:
“You better watch out
You better not cry
Better not pout
I’m telling you why
Santa Claus is coming to town
Santa Claus is coming to town.”
This is clearly a form of psychological conditioning that can only impress upon the child the hopelessness of his or her situation.
So what can be done?
It’s time to package Christmas carol lyrics with warning labels. In this case, something along the lines of the following may be in order:
“Parental Advisory: Explicit language could promote anxiety, sleeplessness, amorality, and humming.”
Frank Mulligan is an editor in GateHouse Media New England’s Raynham office, and can be reached at fmulliga@cnc.com.

entity.property: Santa Claus is coming to Town

description.hltext_display: Start-Ratifizierung in USA praktisch sicher
description.content:
Für US-Präsident Barack Obama stehen die Chancen gut, sein großes außenpolitisches Vorhaben durchzubringen.
Washington (dpa) - Nach heftigen Tauziehen ist die Ratifizierung des Start-Abrüstungsabkommens mit Russland in den USA jetzt praktisch sicher.
Bei einer Vorabstimmung am Dienstag kamen die Demokraten von Präsident Barack Obama auf 67 Stimmen. Das wäre eine ausreichende Zweidrittelmehrheit beim entscheidenden Schlussvotum voraussichtlich an diesem Mittwoch.
Eine Ratifizierung des Vertrags zur Reduzierung strategischer Offensivwaffen ist eines von Obamas größten außenpolitischen Zielen. Die Billigung hatte in den vergangenen Wochen wiederholt an einem seidenen Faden gehangen: Immer wieder gab es Vorbehalte und Blockadeversuche der Republikaner. Russland muss den Vertrag auch noch ratifizieren, hat aber zu erkennen gegeben, dass die Staatsduma grünes Licht geben wird, wenn der Washingtoner Senat dies tut.
Abgestimmt wurde am Dienstag über die Beendigung der Debatte, was nunmehr den Weg zum «Finale» freimacht. 67 Senatoren votierten dafür, 28 dagegen. Elf Republikaner stimmten mit den Demokraten. Beim Schlussvotum muss die Obama-Partei auf Zweidrittel aller abgegebenen Stimmen kommen, also mindestens 67, wenn sich alle 100 Senatoren an dem Votum beteiligen.
Obama versuchte bis zuletzt, skeptische konservative Senatoren persönlich umzustimmen. Er hat seinen Abflug in den Weihnachtsurlaub auf Hawaii verschoben, bis eine Entscheidung gefallen ist.
Unterstützt wurde der Präsident von Generalstabschef Mike Mullen, der die Senatoren vor der Vorabstimmung in einem Brief erneut aufrief, das Abkommen zu billigen. «Der Vertrag verbessert unsere Fähigkeit zu tun, was wir als Militär tun sollen: Die Bürger der USA zu schützen und zu verteidigen. Je schneller es ratifiziert ist, desto besser», schrieb er.
Eine Reihe von Republikanern hatte in den vergangenen Tagen wiederholt versucht, den Abrüstungsvertrag durch Änderungsanträge praktisch zum Scheitern zu bringen. Die Gegner befürchten unter anderem, dass das Abkommen den USA bei ihrem Raketenabwehrprogramm Fesseln anlegt. Obama hat das aber entschieden zurückgewiesen.
Der im April geschlossene Start-Vertrag sieht eine Verringerung des atomaren Waffenarsenals auf je 1550 stationierte strategische Nuklearsprengköpfe auf beiden Seiten vor. Die neue Vereinbarung löst ein Abkommen von 1991 ab, das Ende vergangenen Jahres ausgelaufen ist. Seitdem haben auch keine gegenseitigen Inspektionen der Arsenale mehr stattgefunden.

description.hltext_display: Apology beginning of tagger's new life
description.content:
Reformed tagger Te Arahi Wilson (L) and Tauranga City Council's graffiti prevention officer Jane Denton (R). Photo / Vicki Waterhouse.
Speaking in front of a group of strangers is hard at the best of times, so imagine how Te Arahi Wilson feels - this Gate Pa teenager did just that in front of a group of volunteers who paint out tagging in Tauranga... and Te Arahi was a tagger.
"I told them my name and stuff and said 'I'm sorry for all the damage I've done around Tauranga and I'm sorry that you fellas have to paint'," he says.
The 14-year-old is in the middle of completing his community service sentence after admitting to a massive number of tags around Tauranga.
Te Arahi now spends his days doing what the volunteers do - painting out tagging in Tauranga - and is on the road to improving his life.
He started tagging when he was only eight-years-old.
"It was just fun at the time and I got addicted it and I loved it so I just kept carrying on with it," he says.
All of his mates were tagging, and he got involved in the tagging culture. This year he moved his tagging from hidden corners on to the streets.
"It was an adrenalin rush. It made me happy seeing my stuff around," he says.
He never felt bad about tagging and says, at that stage, he had no idea how devastating it was on the community or how many people were involved in its removal and prevention.
In hindsight, he says, "it doesn't feel that good".
He recalls the police coming to get him from his home in November like it was yesterday.
"I was at home and the police just raided our house," he says. "I was angry."
Te Arahi's anger soon turned to major concern for himself - after he admitted to numerous tags, Tauranga City Council sought $18,000 in reparation.
He also had to deal with the incredible disappointment of his grandmother, who means a lot to him.
"She was sad as, she couldn't even go to sleep, she started getting sick," he says, visibly upset. Her frame of mind improved markedly after Te Arahi apologised to the volunteers, and this is how he wants to continue.
Despite Te Arahi getting caught for defacing public property, he is still passionate about the art behind the graffiti label. He has sold canvases of his urban graffiti art and plans on pursuing it as a career.
Tauranga City Council's graffiti prevention officer Jane Denton says Te Arahi has real talent, and will be able to utilise the legal graffiti walls in Tauranga to showcase his urban art.
It was Ms Denton who encouraged Te Arahi to apologise to the volunteers, and says he has had a great shift in attitude about tagging around town.
Te Arahi is still to appear in Youth Court to discuss a resolution to the situation and has many hours of community work ahead of him.
He has a few words for the taggers of Tauranga: "It's not worth it."

event_or_fact.property: Te Arahi has real talent, and will be able to utilise the legal graffiti walls in Tauranga to showcase his urban art

description.hltext_display: Rövershagen - Träume aus Eis in Erlebnis-Dorf
Basketball: Albertson's big play sparks Pekin past West Washington 46-41
description.content: With less than a minute to play and the score tied at 39, Todd Albertson grabbed the offensive rebound off a missed free throw and turned it into a three- point play to give Eastern Pekin (4-3) a 42-39 lead en route to a 46-41 victory over host West Washington (4-2) in Indiana boys' basketball action at the Washington County Holiday Tournament at West Washington High School.

description.hltext_display: Không có chuyện 5 trẻ ở nhà mở bị bạo hành
description.content:
Các em kể lại sự việc tại hiện trường - Ảnh: Anh Thư
(TNO) Đó là kết luận của Công an TP Biên Hòa (Đồng Nai) sau hơn một tháng điều tra. Công an đã quyết định không khởi tố vụ án hình sự.
>> Điều tra làm rõ vụ các em nhỏ nghi bị bạo hành
Theo Công an TP Biên Hòa, do nghịch ngợm, quậy phá nên Nguyễn Văn Bé Hai (sinh năm 1998) thường xuyên bị bà Lê Thị Thanh Lan (Phó chủ nhiệm Nhà mở Đồng Nai) la mắng. Do vậy tối 7.11, Hai chủ động rủ 4 bạn bỏ trốn khỏi nhà mở.
Trước khi trốn, chỉ có Diệp Tuấn Khoa (2004) bị sưng, bầm tím trên trán và hai mắt do trước đó một tuần em té ngã đập đầu xuống nền nhà khi đang đùa nghịch với Hai. Riêng các cháu còn lại hoàn toàn khỏe mạnh.
Vào khoảng 1 giờ ngày 8.11, Hai thức dậy rủ các bạn bỏ trốn. Quá trình leo qua cổng rào, em Lê Gia Huy (5 tuổi) bị thanh sắt nhọn trên đỉnh cổng đâm vào ngón cái tay trái dẫn đến chảy máu.
Trong số 4 em được rủ, thì Nguyễn Văn Quyết (1997) ngủ quên. Khi tỉnh dậy, Quyết cũng leo rào ra ngoài đi lang thang tại khu vực phường Bửu Long thì được người dân đưa về Tỉnh đoàn Đồng Nai.
Sau khi trốn, Hai, Huy, Khoa và Diệp Hiếu Trung (4 tuổi) qua cầu Hóa An tìm hướng vào TP.HCM. Đến khu vực Cầu Hang (thuộc ấp Cầu Hang, xã Hóa An, TP Biên Hòa), 4 em leo lên trên cầu và ngồi chơi trên đường sắt.
Khi nghe tiếng tàu lửa kéo còi, các em thấy tàu đến gần nên vội nhảy lao xuống dưới chân cầu (cao 6m). Khi nhảy, Huy bị cây đâm vào tay trái gây rách da chảy máu; Khoa bị gãy tay phải, xây xát ở gò má trái, da bụng và lưng, bầm tím trên đỉnh mông phải, dưới hậu môn, mắt cá chân phải.
Công an cũng đã tiến hành đưa mỗi lần hai em đến vị trí té ngã thì các em đều chỉ giống nhau.
Sau đó, các em đã đón xe buýt từ Biên Hòa về bến xe Lê Hồng Phong (TP.HCM) thì được anh Ôn Diệp Thành phát hiện, báo Công an phường 4, quận 5. Sau đó, Khoa và Huy được đưa vào Bệnh viện Nhi đồng chữa trị. Còn Hai và Trung thì đưa vào Trung tâm Hỗ trợ xã hội TP.HCM.
Riêng tình tiết cô Lan nhúng đầu các em vào lu nước, khi về nhà mở, Khoa kể lại không có như trước đây em đã nói (chuyện đó là do nghe Hai kể lại).
Huy cũng kể bị dìm đầu vào xô nước, bị cào rách bụng, nhưng kiểm tra thì miệng xô nhẵn, bụng em không có sẹo.
Riêng Hai khai nhìn thấy Trung bị dìm đầu hai lần và bị sặc nước vào sau Tết năm 2010 khoảng 2-3 tháng, nhưng thực tế Trung lại mới được tiếp nhận vào Nhà mở tháng 6.2010.
Từ lời kể ban đầu của các em, sự việc đã xảy ra nghiêng theo hướng có bạo hành tại nhà mở dẫn đến việc các em bỏ trốn.

description.hltext_display: Seattle ships C Rob Johnson to San Diego
description.content:
The Seattle Mariners have traded catcher Rob Johnson to the San Diego Padres for a player to be named later or cash considerations.
Seattle and San Diego made the deal on Tuesday.
Johnson had been designated for assignment by the Mariners on Dec. 13 after the Mariners signed designated hitter Jack Cust and needed a spot on the 40-man roster.
Johnson was Seattle's opening day starter behind the plate in 2010 but his struggles at the plate eventually led to his demotion to Triple-A Tacoma. The 28-year-old Johnson played in 61 games last season with Seattle, but hit just .191.
He also struggled with an American League-high nine passed balls in less than a half-season.
Johnson never played for the Mariners after Aug. 1. In 18 games at Tacoma, Johnson hit .297.
Johnson was originally the Mariners' fourth-round pick in 2004 and played parts of four seasons in Seattle.

description.hltext_display: Debatte um FDP-Chef Westerwelle dauert an
description.content:
Die Debatte um FDP-Chef Westerwelle wird sich auch in unterschiedlichen Wahlkämpfen der Landesverbände niederschlagen.
Berlin (dpa) - Nach dem neuerlichen Umfrage-Absturz der FDP versuchen führende Liberale, die Debatte über Parteichef Guido Westerwelle zu beruhigen. Entwicklungsminister Dirk Niebel mahnte, die FDP könne nur bestehen, wenn sie zusammenhalte.
Gisela Piltz, stellvertretende Parteivorsitzende in Nordrhein-Westfalen, betonte, öffentliche Personaldebatten lösten keine Probleme. Der Vorsitzende der Jungen Liberalen, Lasse Becker, forderte Westerwelle aber auch zur Selbstkritik auf.
Becker appellierte an den Parteichef, beim Dreikönigstreffen in Stuttgart «selbstkritisch den einen oder anderen Fehler zu benennen». Zudem solle Westerwelle «die Menschen emotionaler als in der Vergangenheit ansprechen», sagte der FDP-Nachwuchspolitiker den «Stuttgarter Nachrichten» (Mittwoch). Von den Wahlergebnissen im Frühjahr 2011 hänge viel ab. «Und beim Bundesparteitag wird analysiert: Wer hat welchen Fehler gemacht, und wie baue ich ein zukunftsfähiges Team.»
Becker forderte zugleich eine inhaltliche Neuausrichtung der FDP: «Jedenfalls wird man nicht dadurch glaubwürdig, dass man zum 200. Mal eine Steuersenkung ankündigt. Wir brauchen einen Schwerpunkt beim Thema Haushaltskonsolidierung.» Die FDP müsse zudem klare Positionen bei der Ablehnung der Vorratsdatenspeicherung und dem Umbau der Sozialsysteme beziehen. «Und wir müssen uns beim Thema nachhaltige, ökologische Marktwirtschaft ein neues Feld erschließen.»
Niebel machte deutlich, dass er jüngeren FDP-Politikern den Parteivorsitz noch nicht zutraut. Die FDP habe zwar eine hervorragende Führungsreserve, sagte er dem «Hamburger Abendblatt» (Mittwoch). «Ich denke allerdings, dass wir denen noch etwas Zeit geben sollten, um ihre Fähigkeiten zu veredeln.» Vom Dreikönigstreffen erwarte er «ein Aufbruchsignal, das weit über Stuttgart hinaus in der Republik sichtbar sein wird», so Niebel. «Ich bin felsenfest davon überzeugt, dass Guido Westerwelle eine mitreißende Rede halten wird.»
Auch Piltz forderte ein Ende der Personaldebatte. Die Geschichte der FDP zeige eindrucksvoll, dass Personaldebatten in kritischen Situationen noch nie geholfen hätten, sagte die nordrhein- westfälische Partei-Vize «Handelsblatt Online». «Die FDP hat im Team gewonnen, und die FDP muss auch im Team Krisen meistern.» In der jüngsten Forsa-Umfrage ist die FDP auf drei Prozent abgesackt.

description.hltext_display: Madrid - Spanische Lotterie schüttet Milliardengewinne aus
Te Puke police Senior Sergeant's tragic accident
description.content:
The crash shut down State Highway 2 to traffic, which by 7.30am had backed up to Papamoa's Domain Rd. Photo / Sam Ackland.
Te Puke police Senior Sergeant Deirdre Lack was rushed to Tauranga Hospital after a head-on collision on State Highway 2, about 1km from Manoeka Rd, about 4.45am.
Te Puke Volunteer Fire Brigade chief fire officer Glenn Williams said the two vehicles involved in this morning's crash finished up about 75m from each other.
It took at least 30 minutes before the drivers were freed and taken to hospital, because the vehicles were so badly damaged.
Mr Williams said all the firefighters knew Miss Lack.
Mr Williams said he spoke to Miss Lack in the vehicle a few times and when her partner arrived at the scene he was able to seat him in the back of her car to comfort her, along with paramedics.
"She was in a lot pain, she was aware because she asked if anyone had called her mother.
"(The crash was) probably one of the hardest for us because we wanted to get her our as quick as we could.
"We had to put someone with her to comfort her until the rescue truck got here from Tauranga."
The crash shut down State Highway 2 to traffic, which by 7.30am had backed up to Papamoa's Domain Rd.
A diversion through Te Puke Quarry Rd was put in place but only cars were allowed through here as the road was narrow and unsealed.
Trucks were left stranded until the road was cleared about 9am.
Miss Lack, 40, suffered serious injuries and was trapped in her vehicle for at least half an hour.
It is believed she was travelling to the gym.
A Tauranga Hospital spokesperson this morning said Miss Lack and the 19-year-old driver of the other car involved in the smash were both in the emergency department suffering from serious injuries. Miss Lack had multiple fractures to her limbs.
It is understood a rescue helicopter was initially called to take a patient to Waikato Hospital but fog in Hamilton meant this was not possible.
Miss Lack's Rotorua-based sister Tracey Lack confirmed to the Bay of Plenty Times that her sister was involved in the accident but remained optimistic she would make a good recovery. She said her parents had phoned her with the news.
She said her parents Robyn and Ron, also based in Rotorua, were this morning on their way to Tauranga.
Western Bay Mayor Ross Paterson had heard about the crash on the radio but was shocked to learn Miss Lack had been involved.
"It's a tragic accident, especially at this time of year for Deirdre, right before Christmas. She is a person that Te Puke has a lot of respect for.
"She's done a lot of work with the local youth in Te Puke and other sections of the community."
Miss Lack, who previously worked in Rotorua, has been the officer in charge of Te Puke police for several years.
She spent five months last year heading the Mount Maunganui station.
Western Bay of Plenty police confirmed a female officer was involved in the crash but would not comment further this morning.
Melissa Hedley, who works at Oceanblue gym in Papamoa, said it was likely Miss Lack was on her way to the gym when the crash happened.
"She comes and trains here and swims in the pool.
"I imagine that's where she was heading - she's one of our 5 o'clockers.
"It's a bit of a shock - I'm sitting here waiting by the phone, waiting to hear [some news], and trying not to cry. I know she will be fine."
She described Miss Lack as "vibrant" and "active" and hoped her fitness would help with her recovery.

description.hltext_display: Seoul - Südkorea kündigt neue Schießübungen an
自从我有了女朋友后的20个惨状
Kindergartenfinanzierung: Viele Fallstricke und Risiken
description.content:
Kreis Warendorf - Das Kindergartenjahr 2008/2009 ist ausgewertet. Es war das erste Kibiz-Jahr. Die Träger der 84 Kindergärten im Kreisjugendamt haben zwei Millionen Euro Rücklagen gebildet. Auch in anderen Kreisen wurde Geld auf die hohe Kante gelegt. Vielerorts hat das zum Vorwurf geführt, die Träger würden Rücklagen bilden statt Personal einzustellen. Redakteurin Beate Kopmann sprach mit dem stellvertretendem Leiter der Zentralrendantur Warendorf, Rainer Grönewäller. Die Zentralrendantur verwaltet 31 katholische Kindergärten im Dekanat Warendorf.
Herr Grönewäller, wie hoch waren die Rücklagen, die Sie im ersten Kibiz-Jahr hatten? Grönewäller: Wir konnten im Durchschnitt rund 38 000 Euro je Einrichtung der gesetzlich vorgeschriebenen Rücklage zuführen. Jetzt sind wir gerade dabei, die Berechnungen für das Folgejahr zu ermitteln. Hier zeigt sich eine deutlich geringere Zuführungsrate. Gut eine Million Euro sind trotzdem eine stolze Summe. Wofür brauchen Sie das Geld? Grönewäller: Die Gelder aus 2008/2009 sind für Baumaßnahmen und Sachkosten schon verbraucht oder verplant. Bis Ende 2010 haben wir nur für U3-Maßnahmen (Ausbau der Kindergärten für Kinder unter drei Jahren) über 6,2 Millionen Euro verbaut. Aus dem Fördertopf des Landes sind 3,6 Millionen Euro, von den Kommunen 176 211 Euro und vom Bistum Münster 521 738 Euro geflossen. Weiter wurden über zwei Millionen Euro investiert, die im Zuge der U3-Maßnahmen notwendig waren. Darüber hinaus gibt es noch einen erheblichen Investitionsstau. Investitionen werden also nicht durch Kibiz gefördert? Grönewäller: Nein, Kibiz stellt den Einrichtungen eine Pauschale zur Verfügung. Davon müssen wir die Personalkosten sowie Sach- und Baukosten bestreiten. Kommen Sie mit der Pauschale aus? Grönewäller: Die Frage nach der Pauschale lässt sich pauschal eben nicht beantworten. Ich muss immer den einzelnen Kindergarten sehen. Einige haben einen Überschuss und andere ein Defizit. Deswegen halte ich es für unglücklich, wenn behauptet wird, die Kibiz-Pauschalen seien auskömmlich. Zu so einer Einschätzung kommen vielleicht Statistiker, wenn sie den Durchschnitt berechnen. Aber wir sind hier an der Front. Wir arbeiten nicht mit Statistiken, sondern mit ganz realen Kosten. Und für die Träger gibt es dabei viele Fallstricke und Risiken. Sind Kindergärten im Bestand gefährdet? Grönewäller: Wir mussten zwei Kindergärten wegen der demografischen Entwicklung schließen, aber auch einen Kindergarten, weil er wirtschaftlich nicht zu fahren war und außerhalb des Kibiz-Systems keine Mittel zu erhalten waren. Woran liegt es, dass die Finanzstruktur so unterschiedlich ist? Grönewäller: Alle Kindergärten erhalten gleich hohe Pauschalen, haben aber unterschiedliche Kostenstrukturen. Für eine Kindergartenleitung sind in einer Drei-Gruppen-Einrichtung zu Beginn 38 000 Euro aufzubringen und am Ende der Laufbahn über 56 000 Euro. Vergleichbare Einrichtungen liegen so schnell 80 000 Euro auseinander bei gleichem Einnahmetopf. Die Kirche wird aber ihrer sozialen Verantwortung gerecht und zahlt Tariflöhne. Haben Sie durch Kibiz auch Personal abgebaut? Grönewäller: Nein, das Gegenteil ist der Fall. Gerade in Drei-/Zweigruppenanlagen ist deutlich aufgestockt worden. Wie viel Geld brauchen Sie als Rücklage im Jahr? Grönewäller: Zuführungen von 50 000 Euro sind in Ordnung. Wir haben beispielsweise erhebliche Investitionsmaßnahmen und müssen hierfür Rücklagen bilden, weil keine Zuschüsse gezahlt werden. Aber es gibt auch Einrichtungen, die aufgrund einer günstigen Kostenstruktur kurzzeitig über 100 000 Euro Überschuss einfahren können. Deswegen rege ich eine Kappungsgrenze an. Alles was darüber hinausgeht, fließt zurück ins System und geht in einen Feuerwehrtopf - etwa um defizitäre Einrichtungen zu stützen. Aber das müsste der Gesetzgeber regeln.

description.hltext_display: 啼笑皆非的男女有别
漂亮MM和普通MM的区别
小时侯做过的无聊又可爱的事
description.content:
2、上厕所时企图用尿把屎冲走
3、追在别人后面踩别人的影子
4、把桔子等软物滚到马路中间等车来噗哧压烂
5、把手插进米缸里面插来插去
6、走路一定要隔一个砖踩一个或是不踩缝
7、挤塑料包装纸上的气泡听啪啪的声音
8、在饭馆把包一次性筷子的塑料套拉得很长很长
9、然后在吃烧烤时用火烧那双木筷子
10、用打火机烧自己头发看它羞涩的卷起来，然后把焦黑的小球捏碎
11、在滚梯上往反方向跑
12、拿刀切橡皮，用圆规戳桌子，把笔帽吸在舌头上，用胶条缠手指
13、把萤光笔当成指甲油涂指甲
14、用涂改液把螺丝钉上的十字凹槽填满
15、把三层的纸巾一层层分成薄片
16、撕老式墙的墙皮并以撕下最大块为荣，剥中药丸外面的白色蜡皮并以整块剥下为荣
17、摩红砖头粉，收集红色粉末
18、下雨打伞时转伞看水珠飞出去
19、冬天的时候踩路面上结的薄冰

description.hltext_display: 女生在澡堂里做的那些雷人事
description.content:
一、遇到超倒霉的MM
有回在澡堂遇到一个倒霉的MM。我和她上过一个选修课，她好像还是数学系某班的班花，满漂亮，瘦瘦的。当时不是洗澡高峰期，空的莲蓬头挺多的，她连试了4个都是坏的，有三个是怎么捣鼓都不出水，还有一个只能喷凉水。那时是冬天，天窗里的寒风吹进来，吹得澡堂里白色的热气忽忽悠悠，大家都躲在里面热火朝天地洗洗涮涮，只有她一人，光着瘦弱的身子，抱着小篮子，一脸茫然地站在澡堂的空地上发抖，还被浇了一头凉水。我赶紧招呼她过来跟我一起洗，她过来以后我的莲蓬也不出水了，我和她只好各自另找人合洗。后来再见她，才知道那天我走了以后她也一直不顺，那个倒霉的澡折腾了她将近3个小时，回去就感冒了。
二、巧遇校花姐姐
我喜欢翘课洗下午两点的澡，这时候澡堂里人少，洗起来特别舒服（大家不要学我），但由此遇到的“澡友”也通常是一些30多岁的校工、老师家属什么的，没啥姿色。不过有一次，上午体育课测800米来着，大家都出一身汗，结果下午全班女生几乎都逃课去洗澡了（可怜的高数小老头）。就是那回，遇到我们的校花了，哇，运气好啊，我们校花在全北京市高

description.hltext_display: 问世间情为何物 一物降一物
港剧迷一定见过很多回的台词
description.content:
1、最重要就是全家人在一起开开心心~~~（眼熟么？）
3、那，做人呢最重要的就是开心。（要用语重心长的口气来说）
4、能不能过到这一关，关键还要看他自己。（受伤后）
5、老兄,没长眼睛啊（一般都有肢体语言，用食指指着对方说）
6、喂喂，你不是吧。。。（一般脸上都一副欠揍的表情）
7、香港是一个讲法制的社会（一说这话对方就无可奈何了）
8、不会的 不可能 你们骗我 让我进去！
9、让我一个人静一静（遇到心事）
10、就算你不为自己着想，也要替你**着想呃！(汗，眼熟么？ ）
11、那·那·那·那（我最恶心的一句，一直那你个头啊）
12、“我刚刚去元朗买了老婆饼”或者“我去**买了烧鹅”（香港人最爱吃的食物）
13、发生这种事，大家都不想的。。。。。。（弄巧成拙之后最常用的一句话）
14、对不起 我们已经尽力了、、- -（医生常常出手术室说的一句话）

A Huge Number of Ancient Coins Unearthed in Central China
description.content:
An abundant of ancient coins were discovered in central China on Monday, weighing up to several tonnes.
When working on the construction site in front of a middle school in Huaxian, a town in Shaanxi Province, workers discovered a huge cellar that full of coins, which experts believe were made in Song Dynasty about one thousand years ago.
The cellar is about one meter high, two meters wide and more than two meters deep.

description.hltext_display: Krakow am See/Rostock - 70-Jährige bei Brand verletzt
Chemical reaction sparks evacuation
description.content:
Fire trucks lined up on Totara St outside Orica. Photo / Sam Ackland.
A reaction at a Mount Maunganui chemical plant led to a section of Totara St being blocked off by police and the building being evacuated while firefighters diluted the chemicals.
A plume of white steam erupted from the hydrogen peroxide container filling the facility at Orica Chemnet about 3.15pm yesterday, due to a valve accidently being left open on the filling line.
Site manager Paul Hastie said the hydrogen peroxide - used for bleaching and disinfecting in industrial processes - then flowed into the catchment pit, which was designed to contain such leaks.
"The leaked hydrogen peroxide reacted with dust and dirt residing in the catchment pit, which reacted to form oxygen and water," he said.
The reaction resulted in a highly-visible but harmless plume of water vapour coming out of the pit.
"There were no injuries and no damage to the facility or neighbouring properties," Mr Hastie said.
Following the reaction, the section of Totara St between Triton Ave and Hull Rd was blocked to traffic, and all Orica staff were evacuated.
Firefighters from Mount Maunganui, Greerton, Tauranga and Te Puke all worked to dilute the chemicals, using a spray of water.
The owner of a nearby business, who did not wish to be named, saw the effects of the chemical reaction from his front door.
"(It was) like a smoke cloud, but it wasn't, it was probably more like chemical," he said, "They shut it down quite quickly."
The man said due to the nature of the chemical plant, businesses along Totara St had been informed they would be contacted by phone if required to evacuate.
However, he said in 12 years working across the road from Orica, this had never occurred.
Down the road at HirePool, manager Adrian Penberthy said he saw a "big plume" at Orica adding it was lucky the wind was blowing along Totara St, towards Hewletts Rd, otherwise the plume may have blown straight into the garage at the business.
Mount Maunganui Fire Brigade station officer Roger Pickett said when firefighters arrived at Orica the hydrogen peroxide was bubbling, generating a lot of heat and steam.
He said the chemical was heavier than water and when it reacted with dirt on the bottom of the tank, the rainwater on top began to boil.
Firefighters were at the scene until about 6pm with chemists carrying out regular tests to ensure the ph levels and temperature in the tank were returning to normal.
As a precaution, chemists from Orica tested the contents of the catchment pit and some liquid on the yard roadway.
"Tests confirmed that only trace levels of hydrogen peroxide were present, which posed no threat to people or the environment," Mr Hastie said.
The roadway was then washed down to stormwater.
The contents of the catchment pit was transferred to the site effluent tanks today.

description.hltext_display: Man and boy killed in house blaze
description.content:
A man and a young boy have died after a house fire caused by a chip pan left unattended on a cooker, emergency services said.
West Midlands Ambulance Service said both victims were confirmed dead shortly after their arrival at hospital following the blaze in the Lower Stoke area of Coventry.
An ambulance service spokesman said three ambulances and a paramedic officer were sent to the property in Hollis Road after several 999 calls.
The spokesman said: "On arrival, firefighters were bringing the two patients out of the smoke-filled house. "As further crews were only seconds away, the first (crew to arrive) decided to leave the scene immediately with the child to take him to University Hospital in Coventry. "While the crew worked on the child, a firefighter drove the ambulance." Both victims were in cardiac arrest when they were rescued from the two-storey terrace house and fire crews also attempted to resuscitate the adult victim.
The ambulance service spokesman said the second crew to arrive immediately took over efforts to revive the man before taking him to the same hospital. "Sadly, despite the best efforts of fire, ambulance and hospital staff, it was not possible to save either the man or the boy and they were both confirmed dead shortly after arrival at hospital," the spokesman said.

description.hltext_display: Oil above $90 a barrel in Asia as US crude supply drop suggests demand improving
description.content:
SINGAPORE - Oil prices rose above US$90 a barrel Wednesday in Asia after a report showed U.S. crude supplies dropped more than expected for a second week, which suggests demand is improving.
Benchmark oil for February delivery was up 19 cents to $90.01 a barrel at late afternoon Singapore time in electronic trading on the New York Mercantile Exchange. The contract rose 45 cents to settle at $89.82 on Tuesday.
The American Petroleum Institute said late Tuesday that crude inventories fell 5.8 million barrels last week while analysts surveyed by Platts, the energy information arm of McGraw-Hill Cos., had forecast a drop of 2.4 million barrels. Inventories of gasoline decreased 2.9 million barrels and distillates rose slightly, the API said.
The Energy Department's Energy Information Administration reports its weekly supply data later Wednesday. The EIA said last week that supplies dropped 9.9 million barrels the previous week, the biggest drop in eight years.
Oil prices, which rose to a two-year high above $90 earlier this month, have been supported by rallying stock markets. Meanwhile, a strengthening U.S. dollar, which makes crude more expensive for investors with other currencies, has weighed on oil.
"A steady-higher stock market continues to provide a major counter against a likely renewed weakening in the euro," Ritterbusch and Associates said in a report. "A choppy, sideways trade could persist through the balance of this year."
In other Nymex trading in January contracts, heating oil rose 0.4 cent to $2.52 a gallon, gasoline futures added 1.5 cents to $2.41 a gallon and natural gas advanced 0.9 cent to $4.07 per 1,000 cubic feet.
In London, Brent crude rose 30 cents to $93.50 a barrel on the ICE Futures exchange.
(TSX:ECA, TSX:IMO, TSX:SU, TSX:HSE, NYSE:BP, NYSE:COP, NYSE:XOM, NYSE:CVX, TSX:CNQ, TSX:TLM, TSX:COS.UN, TSX:CVE)

description.hltext_display: Pacquiao to face Mosley May 7 in Las Vegas
description.content:
WINDSOR, Ontario (UPDATE) - Manny Pacquiao will fight Shane Mosley, a former champion in three divisions, on May 7 in Las Vegas, promoter Bob Arum said Tuesday.
The fight, to be held at the MGM Grand, will be contested at the welterweight limit of 147 pounds, Top Rank promoter Arum told Reuters in a telephone interview.
"Mosley is very dangerous, he's a very slick fighter, very experienced," said Arum. "Manny's style is made to order for Shane. It should be a very, very interesting fight."
After considering a choice between Mosley, lightweight champion Juan Manuel Marquez and WBC welterweight champion Andre Berto, Pacquiao (52-3-2, 38 KOs) informed Arum of his choice last week in the Philippines.
"He (Pacquiao) liked Mosley because Mosley is better known than the other two," Arum said of the choice. "It is a name selection. He picked the guy that is known to more people because that is going to generate interest in the fight."
Arum said finalized the bout on Tuesday.
The 32-year-old Pacquiao, the current WBO welterweight champion and widely considered the world's best pound-for-pounder fighter, would have preferred a bout with undefeated Floyd Mayweather Jr., said Arum.
"We made no secret that Mayweather was our top priority," said Arum. "All Mayweather had to do was signal to us that he would have been available pending his court situation and we would have waited, but we heard nothing from him.
"Nobody has talked to him, he hasn't talked to anybody."
Mayweather, 33, was arrested at a Las Vegas casino last week on a misdemeanor battery charge after he allegedly assaulted a security guard at his gated community.
The 39-year-old Mosley, a Californian, is 46-6-1 with 39 knockouts but has a loss and a draw in his last two fights. He dropped a unanimous decision to Mayweather in May and had a draw with Sergio Mora in September.
Marquez fought Pacquiao to a draw in a 2004 featherweight championship fight and lost a split decision in a 2008 junior lightweight title fight.

description.hltext_display: Magna International Rises 3.12% on Heavy Volume: Watch For Potential Pullback (MGA)
description.content:
Magna International (NYSE:MGA) traded in a range yesterday that spanned from a low of $50.85 to a high of $52.91. Yesterday, the shares gained 3.12%, which took the trading range above the 3-day high of $51.54 on volume of 1.5 million shares. Often times after large one-day gains, short term traders will seek to take profits and, as such, investors should be cautious.
Shares of Magna International are currently trading above their 50-day moving average (MA) of $47.67 and above their 200-day MA of $38.44. Look for the MA to provide support for a short-term pullback in the shares.
SmarTrend currently has shares of Magna International in an Uptrend and issued the Uptrend alert on July 14, 2010 at $35.88. The stock has risen 42.1% since the Uptrend alert was issued.
SmarTrend expects the share price to pullback toward the $51.54 support level. Afterwards, we expect it to move upward with its peers in the SmarTrend Auto Parts industry.

American Central Transport Commemorates Rentschler Retirement
description.content:
Category: Trucking News
(Liberty, MO) - American Central Transport, Inc. (ACT) recently honored David Rentschler on his retirement from the company after more than 14 years of active service as an ACT over-the-road driver. Rentschler was summoned to the ACT headquarters under the guise of needing to pick up a load and was instead surprised to be recognized for his retirement and presented with a trucking pocket watch. "The only thing I regret," said Rentschler, "is that I didn't spend more of my career with ACT."
Rentschler, 69, lives in Paris, MO with his wife of 51 years, Nancy. He intends to spent his time catching up on woodworking and home remodeling, gardening and spending time with family.

Two horror crashes: motorcyclist dies
description.content:
Police at the site of this morning's smash north of Te Puke.
A senior Western Bay of Plenty police officer has been seriously hurt in a horror smash north of Te Puke this morning and a motorcyclist has died following a crash at Mount Maunganui yesterday.
Te Puke police Senior Sergeant Deirdre Lack was rushed to Tauranga Hospital after a head-on collision on State Highway 2, about 1km from Manoeka Rd, about 4.45am this morning.
In another crash, motorcyclist Justin David Lagas, 30, from Tauranga, died following a collision in Mount Maunganui yesterday.
See today's Bay of Plenty Times for more photos and details.

description.hltext_display: Polizei bittet um Hinweise: Mann aus Riesenbeck wieder aufgetaucht
description.content:
Riesenbeck. Passanten trafen den 51-jährigen Vermissten am Dienstagabend gegen 19.40 Uhr, auf dem Schwarzen Weg in Hörstel an und informierten die Polizei.
Zuvor hatte die Polizei bittet die Bevölkerung um Hinweise gebeten. Der 51-Jährige wurde am Dienstag kurz vor Mittag als vermisst gemeldet worden.

Often times after large one-day gains, short term traders will seek to take profits and, as such, investors should be cautious.
Shares of General Growth Properties are currently trading above their 50-day moving average (MA) of $14.49 and above their 200-day MA of $12.36. Look for the MA to provide support for a short-term pullback in the shares.
SmarTrend currently has shares of General Growth Properties in an Uptrend and issued the Uptrend alert on September 13, 2010 at $12.02. The stock has risen 30.7% since the Uptrend alert was issued.
SmarTrend expects the share price to pullback toward the $15.87 support level. Afterwards, we expect it to move upward with its peers in the SmarTrend REIT- Retail industry.

description.hltext_display: قيمة العقود المسجلة تتجاوز الـ (10) ملايين ريال عماني بشمال الباطنة خلال نوفمبر الماضي
description.content:
قال محمد بن علي المطوع مساعد مدير عام الإسكان لمنطقة شمال الباطنة ان إجمالي قيمة العقود المسجلة في مجال النشاط العقاري في المنطقة خلال شهر نوفمبر من العام الحالي تجاوزت (10) ملايين ريال عماني من خلال تسجيل (602) تصرف قانوني كما تجاوزت الرسوم المحصلة خلال نفس الفترة (70) ألف ريال عماني مشيرا إلى انه تم تسجيل (577) قطعة أرض جديدة وإصدار (882) سند ملكية أرض.
وقال المطوع بأن تصرفات عقود البيع بلغت (283) عقدا بقيمة (712615) ريالا عمانيا وتسجيل (60) عقدا في الرهن وفك الرهن و(38) في الهبة و(187) في الإرث و(4) عقود في المبادلة و(22) عقدا في القسمة مضيفا ان الملكيات الصادرة توزعت بواقع (329) ملكية في ولاية صحم و(182) ملكية في ولاية الخابورة و(316) في ولاية شناص و(55) ملكية في ولاية لوى.
أما عن تفاصيل الأراضي المسجلة لأول مرة خلال الشهر الماضي فقال مساعد مدير عام الإسكان لمنطقة شمال الباطنة إنها توزعت على جميع الولايات التابعة للمديرية حيث تم تسجيل (229) قطعة أرض في ولاية شناص و(26) قطعة ارض في ولاية لوى و(214) قطعة ارض في ولاية صحم في حين تم تسحيل (108) قطع اراض في ولاية الخابورة كما تم منح (174) قطعة ارض منها (173) في ولاية صحم وقطعة أرض واحدة في ولاية الخابورة.
وقال محمد المطوع إنه تم توفير (2894) قطعة ارض في المخططات التفصيلية المنجزة خلال شهر نوفمبر من خلال مخطط ديل آل عبدالسلام رقم (467) في ولاية صحم الذي وفر (2857) قطعة ارض في حين وفر مخطط جنح ـ وادي الصرمي بولاية الخابورة (37) قطعة أرض.
واختتم محمد بن علي المطوع مساعد مدير عام الإسكان لمنطقة شمال الباطنة حديثه قائلا بأن اللجان المحلية بولايات منطقة شمال الباطنة قد قامت بمعاينة (105) قضايا منها (58) قضية في ولاية صحم و(28) قضية في ولاية الخابورة و(9) قضايا في ولاية لوى و(10) قضايا في ولاية شناص وتم تسجيل (66) قضية منها (20) قضية في ولاية صحم و(17) قضية في ولاية الخابورة و(5) قضايا في ولاية لوى و(24) قضايا في ولاية شناص.

description.hltext_display: Tågproblem i Västsverige
description.content:
Efter en mycket kall natt i hela landet, med -36 grader i Idre, är ett nytt område med snö på väg in över norra Götaland och Hälsingland. Kraftiga förseningar väntas i tågtrafiken i dag också. Flygtrafiken till och från London ska fungera som normalt i dag. SMHI har utfärdat en klass 1-varning för att omkring en decimeter snö kan komma fram i Hälsingland under morgonen och förmiddagen.
Trafikverket har satt in extra resurser för att gårdagens snöproblem ska undvikas i dag. Trots det väntas kraftiga förseningar i Västsverige. På grund av växelfel kommer tågen på sträckorna Halmstad-Göteborg och Halmstad-Malmö, det vill säga Västkustbanan, att drabbas av kraftiga förseningar.
Även på sträckan Charlottenberg-Laxå är det problem med tågväxlar vilket orsakar störningar.
-Det vi har är efterdyningar av gårdagens stora problem med växelfel, säger Tommy Andersson på SJ:s pressjour.-En del tåg har hamnat på fel plats i omloppet, kan man säga.
Ett 20-tal tåg i Mälardalen kommer att ersättas av buss och en del passagerare har blivit ombokade till andra avgångar.
Flygtrafiken till och från London ska återupptas i nära nog normal omfattning i dag.
-Som det ser ut just nu så har vi ställt in en Londontur från Stockholm i eftermiddag och från Göteborg ställer vi in en tur och retur till London. Resten hoppas vi verkligen att vi ska kunna få i väg, säger SAS informationschef Elisabeth Manzi.
Situationen i London är fortfarande kaosartad, SAS har närmare 6 000 svenskar strandade där.
För att få hem så många som möjligt planerar SAS att byta till större flygplan.
-Men det är svårt att sitta och lova något, det blir en så skör situation när så många är drabbade. Men nu håller vi tummarna, för vi behöver verkligen lätta på trycket.-Självklart är vårt mål att alla ska få fira jul hemma. Vi gör allt för att få hem alla, säger Elisabeth Manzi.
SAS har kallat in extra personal för att svara på frågor och sköta ombokningar för alla de som drabbats, men väntetiderna har varit mycket långa.
-Vi hoppas på förståelse, men de har förstås behövt utrusta sig med en stor portion tålamod.
Snöröjningen på Londonflygplatsen Heathrow har fått mycket hård kritik.
-Jag är inte någon expert på snöröjning men vi kan ju konstatera att de inte har klarat av att leverera det vi köper, nämligen möjligheten att kunna flyga till den flygplatsen. De har uppenbarligen inte klarat att leva upp till de önskvärda nivåerna, säger Elisabeth Manzi.
När det gäller Paris, Amsterdam och Frankfurt är man i stort sett i kapp med strandade passagerare eftersom trafiken har kunnat upprätthållas, om än med förseningar och inställda flyg.

description.hltext_display: OCTOBER CONTRACTORS & DRIVERS OF THE MONTH NAMED AT PRIME
description.content:
Category: Trucking News
(Springfield, Mo.) – Prime inc. recently honored driving associates in its refrigerated, flatbed and tanker divisions for exhibiting exceptional service, safety practices, professionalism and productivity.
The following individuals were recognized in October for their outstanding efforts:
Refrigerated Division: Independent Contractor Thomas S. Jones; Company Driver Christopher Pope; and Team Drivers Richard Swazer and Darrin Dugan. Flatbed Division: Independent Contractor Robert F. Saling and Company Driver Troy D. Mowery. Tanker Division: Independent Contractor Brian Morrison and Company Driver Nicholas Hennigh.
“Drivers and associates in each division are recognized each month for their performance in regards to fuel cost, accident history, on-time performance, log history and other factors,” said Don Lacy, Prime inc. director of safety. “Prime prides itself on providing the highest level of service in the industry and we are pleased to honor these driving professionals for their hard work.”
Each honoree receives a Contractor/Driver of the Month Certificate, a voucher for $25 to purchase a custom-embroidered shirt at Prime’s company store and $100. “The name of each honoree is added to the 2010 plaque in the Millennium building and will be eligible for an annual award at year-end,” Lacy added.
Congratulations to Prime’s October honorees. For information on Prime’s services or career opportunities, visit www.primeinc.com.

description.hltext_display: الرمحي في تصريح خاص لــ عُمان: خطة لضم العمانية للمصافي والبتروكيماويات وعمان بولي بروبلين والعطريات
description.content:
جريدة عمان 22/12/2010
كشف معالي الدكتور محمد بن حمد الرمحي وزير النفط والغاز عن خطة تدرسها الحكومة حاليا لضم ثلاث شركات هي الشركة العمانية للمصافي والبتروكيماويات وشركة عمان بولي بروبلين والشركة العمانية للعطريات البتروكيميائية الواقعتان في ميناء صحار.
وقال في تصريح خاص لـ (عُمان): إن المشروع ينظر فيه من قبل الجهات الحكومية المعنية متوقعاًَ أن يتم بشكل رسمي خلال العام القادم.
وذكر معاليه أن هذا الربط يهدف إلى إنشاء مجمع متكامل يسهل إدارة عملية الإنتاج في هذه الشركات وتقليل حجم المصروفات وتوحيد الإدارة نظراً لوجود تنافس بينها خصوصا في الوقت الحالي فيما يتعلق باستقطاب الموظفين.
كما سيعمل المشروع على توحيد نظام التقاعد لهذه الشركات حيث تخضع الشركة العمانية للمصافي والبتروكيماويات حالياً لصندوق تقاعد خاص بها، فيما تتبع شركتا عمان بولي بروبلين والشركة العمانية للعطريات البتروكيميائية نظام الهيئة العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية. ولم يوضح معالي الدكتور وزير النفط والغاز الاسم الجديد لهذا التكامل مشيراً إلى أنه يخضع للموافقات القانونية. وتعتمد شركتا عمان بولي بروبلين والشركة العمانية للعطريات البتروكيميائية في موادهما الأولية على مصفاة نفط صحار التي تم دمجها قبل نحو عامين مع مصفاة ميناء الفحل تحت مسمى الشركة العمانية للمصافي والبتروكيماوت بموجب المرسوم السلطاني رقم 99/2007. وتعد شركة عمان بولي بروبلين إحدى الشركات العالمية لصناعة البتروكيماويات في السلطنة.
كما انها واحدة من أكبر موردي البولي بروبلين للشركات في العالم، وقد بدأت إنتاجها في أواخر عام 2006 وبلغت استثمارات المصنع حوالي 120 مليون ريال عماني حيث تملك شركة النفط العمانية 40 بالمائة وإل جي العالمية 20 بالمائة، ومؤسسة الخليج للاستثمار 20 بالمائة والشركة العالمية لاستثمارات النفط 20 بالمائة ويقوم المصنع بإنتاج 340 ألف طن متري سنويا. كما تعتبر الشركة العمانية للعطريات والبتروكيميائية مشروعا استثماريا مشتركا بين شركة نفط عمان التي تمتلك (70%) والشركة العمانية للمصافي والبتروكيماويات 20% وشركة إل جي انترناشيونال الكورية (10%). وبدأت الشركة مرحلة التشغيل في منتصف 2009.

description.hltext_display: Saudi king leaves hospital in good health - agency
description.content:
Saudi Arabia's elderly King Abdullah has left a New York hospital in good health, the kingdom's state news agency said on Wednesday.
The king, thought to be around 86 or 87, had surgery on his back in New York in November after a blood clot complicated a slipped spinal disc.
The kingdom's health minister said afterward that his health was "very reassuring."
King Abdullah underwent a second successful operation on December 2 to stabilise vertebrae in his spinal column, the royal court said in a statement carried by the Saudi state news agency. �

description.hltext_display: Dorf Mecklenburg - Kaum Leerstand durch erfolgreiche Vermietung
My Pet World: You can't force newly adopted dog to adore you
description.author: Steve Dale
description.content:
Q. How can I get my puppy to be more attached to me? She's a mixed breed we adopted 2 months ago from a shelter. She's 9 months old. It's not like she dislikes our family but she doesn't seem madly in love with us like other dogs have been. I don't see Daisy standing in front of a train to give her life for us.
— D.H., Cyberspace
A. 'Give the honeymoon more time,' says dog trainer Victoria Schade, author of 'Bonding With Your Dog: A Trainer's Secrets for Building a Better Relationship' (Wiley Publishing, 2009). 'Is the dog appreciating physical contact or maybe you're making too much contact for this individual dog? I mean, you didn't even date first. Instead of trying too hard, let the dog come to you. And think about speaking softly and offering soft massages.'
A great way to bond with a dog is an upbeat training class, adds Schade, of Bucks County, Pa. You're having fun together and working for a common goal, even if that goal is simply walking without the pup pulling you. Speaking of fun, have a good time doing what your dog likes, be that playing fetch or pulling a wiggle toy.
"It's not likely, and unpopular to talk about, but it's possible you may not be the right family for Daisy," Schade says. "Some dogs can't tolerate young children. They may never be aggressive but they just don't like kids, no matter what you do. But first, try to have fun, don't think too much, and give the relationship more time."
Q. My 9-year-old
Sheltie recently began to eat hymnals and novels. At first, I thought he was after the glue in the binding, but then Charley began to destroy sheet music. I took him to the vet to discuss the problem. The exam only revealed protein in Charley's urine. The vet didn't know what to do except give him steroids. Now, we've also caught our 4-year-old Sheltie in the act. Any advice?
— C.W., Las Vegas
A. I doubt steroids would help much and might not be a good idea given your dog's potential kidney problems. Veterinary behaviorist Dr. Nicholas Dodman, chairman of the behavior clinic at Tufts Cummings School of Veterinary Medicine in North Grafton, Mass., says the protein in the urine may indicate kidney disease, which may go hand-in-glove with anemia, which may cause the dog's indiscriminate appetite. Speak to your vet about the suspected kidney issue, and see if treatment for this problem lessens Charley's appetite for paper.
It's unclear if the problem occurs both when you're home and when you're away. If it crops up solely when you're gone, it's likely due to separation anxiety. It may be your younger dog is becoming anxious because Charley is anxious, or more likely, the younger dog is simply mimicking the behavior.
If the paper chewing occurs only when you're in the room, this could be an attention-seeking behavior. Dogs can sometimes be easily "trained" to do the strangest things just because we offer attention, even if that's only reprimanding the pet.
Dodman says other possibilities to consider are physical causes, including digestion or bowel issues and, rarely, seizures. If your dogs are ingesting the paper, both could develop a gastrointestinal obstruction, so do your best to keep paper out of reach.
This might be a problem for a veterinary behaviorist (dacvb. org) or member of the American Veterinary Society of Animal Behavior (avsabonline. org).
Q. I moved to Nevada from Illinois in July, bringing my 8-year-old cat with me. Rug never previously ventured outside, but he got out recently and is lost. I'm devastated. How can I best get the word out about my lost black cat?
— S.S., North Las Vegas
A. I received your e-mail about five days ago, and my hope is you've found your beloved cat. I also hope Rug is wearing an ID tag and is microchipped, which greatly enhances your chances of finding him. If Rug is chipped and also happens to be enrolled in the popular HomeAgain Pet Recovery Service (home again.com), call to report him lost and HomeAgain will issue alerts via e-mail and the new HomeAgain iPhone app, which gets the word out to an army of volunteers nationwide.
Sadly, your situation is proof that indoor-only cats do get out. This happens more often after a move.
Don't just call all area shelters but also visit them. Don't depend on a volunteer to identify your black cat out of many black cats in the shelter. Post lost cat notices with a recent photo of Rug and offer a reward. Put them up at local grocery stores, coffee shops, groomers, veterinary clinics and pet stores, even on no parking signs.
If you're on Twitter, send out persistent tweets. Set up a Facebook page for your lost pet. Check out HomeAgain's Guide to Find Lost Indoor Cats at petdetectivetraining.com.
(Gary MacPhee, director of the HomeAgain Business Unit at Intervet/Schering-Plough Animal Health. contributed to this answer.)
Q. My cat pulls out his fur in clumps and licks himself constantly. The result is a huge hairball problem. I've had him to three veterinarians, and each time prednisolone was prescribed. This helped some at first but is now totally ineffective. My cat is adorable, and I feel so bad for him. Can you help?
— J.A., Clearwater, Fla.
A. If you haven't already done so, make sure that a fungal infection and parasites, especially fleas, have been ruled out as possible causes of the problem. Even indoor cats, especially where you live, can get fleas.
"Allergies could be the issue," says feline specialty veterinarian Dr. Drew Weig-ner, of Atlanta.
He suggests you see a feline veterinarian or a veterinary dermatologist who might be able to pinpoint the allergy involved or if your cat even has an allergy. An unlikely possibility is your cat is licking compulsively.
Also, ask your vet about treating the hairballs. While this won't solve your cat's underlying problem, making hairballs less frequent will help him feel more comfortable until you pinpoint the problem.
Write to Steve Dale at Tribune Media Services, 2225 Kenmore Ave., Suite 114, Buffalo, NY 14207. Send e-mail to petworld@stevedale.tv. Include your name, city and state.

description.hltext_display: فولتامب تحصل على أول طلب تصنيع لمشروعها الجديد
description.content:
أعلنت شركة فولتامب أنها حصلت على أول طلب تصنيع لمشروعها الجديد لمحولات الجهد العالي في صحار. جاء الطلب من الشركة العمانية لنقل الكهرباء لتصنيع أربعة محولات سعة 125 ميجا فولت أمبير، 132 كيلو فولت على أن يتم الأنتهاء منها خلال الاثنى عشر شهرا القادمة. وقد فازت فولتامب بهذا الطلب عبر منافسة شديدة مع أكثر من 20 شركة دولية.
وصرح قيس من محمد اليوسف رئيس مجلس الإدارة بأن شركة فولتامب ترسل عظيم شكرها لقطاع الكهرباء العماني والشركة العمانية لنقل الكهرباء بشكل خاص على الثقة الكبيرة في قدراتها التقنية وجودة منتجاتها، واعدا بأن الشركة ستكون عند حسن الظن بها. مضيفا: لسنوات طويلة ظلت السلطنة تستورد المحولات من هذه السعة من الخارج لذلك فهذه تعتبر لحظة عظيمة ليس لنا فقط ولكن لكل عمان».
وتم الإنتهاء من الأعمال الإنشائية بالمصنع الجديد وتجري حاليا آخر الأعمال لتركيب المعدات والآلات. وسيشهد الربع الأول من العام القادم بدء الإنتاج كما هو مخطط بحيث سيتم أنتاج أول محول بالكامل في أبريل القادم. كما أن أغلب الشركات بالمنطقة أبدت اهتمامها الشديد بمصنع فولتامب لمحولات الجهد العالي حيث ان الشركة بالفعل تلقت العديد من الطلبات والعروض من داخل وخارج السلطنة حتى الآن.
وستقوم فولتامب أيضا بعمليات الصيانة والإصلاح سواء بداخل المصنع او خارجه، وهي بالفعل قامت بإصلاح أكثر من 40 محولا من مختلف المصنعيين، ومع المصنع الجديد ستكون فولتامب هي الشركة الوحيدة في منطقة الخليج العربي التي تملك القدرة لإصلاح وصيانة الأحجام الأكبر من محولات الجهد العالي، معززة بذلك قدراتها الفنية وريادتها في المنطقة.

description.hltext_display: Greerton cameras make a difference
description.content:
Many Greerton retailers and residents say CCTV has been good for the area. Photo / File.
Long-awaited security cameras at Greerton are already having an impact on would-be criminals, with not one bag-snatching reported since their induction in May.
The closed circuit television cameras were installed after several failed attempts by the Greerton Village Community Association to get Tauranga City Council to fund them. After more than two years of requests the money was raised through other means and they were installed independently.
The association wanted the cameras installed in response to growing concerns for the safety of residents and retailers. In the shopping area alone there had been assaults, tagging, vandalism, burglary and young people hassling passers-by in the street.
Greerton Village Community Association chairman Ray Dean says the cameras are doing their job but they are not quite finished with the installation.
"They've definitely had an effect," he says. "We're more than happy with what they're doing at the moment."
He says the next stage is to get the last few cameras up and running and let people know they're there.
"There's not a lot of signage around to say we have cameras," he says.
Mainstreet Greerton manager Graeme Morrissey says is delighted with the results of the introduction of cameras and is receiving great feedback from the community.
"They've been very successful," he says.
"We're absolutely rapt with how they've come along."
Mr Morrissey says people appreciate "knowing there are eyes watching" and are glad there is some form of record of what is happening in the streets.
The cameras record 24/7 and are monitored by National Security Group who are able to pass on footage to the police. There have been a few minor crimes in the area, Mr Morrissey says, and the police have been in touch to access the security footage.
Tauranga South Community Constable Leanne Fairbairn confirms footage has been retrieved from the CCTV cameras although no offenders have been identified from the footage as yet.
Despite the fact nobody had been caught with the use of the camera footage of evidence, Ms Fairbairn says they are still a good idea.
"There's a lot of positive talk about them... they're another tool," she says.
Several shop owners and workers in mainstreet Greerton agreed the CCTV cameras were beneficial to the area.
"Even if you can't catch them at the time, there's something there," says Red Cross shop volunteer Jan McLintock.
Snipz Organics owner Jude Griffiths says she's really happy the cameras are there for her staffs benefits. It means when they go home after late night opening hours they are being watched over, she says.
However not everyone felt the cameras were beneficial. Greerton Quality Meats owner David Pinkerton says there has still been excessive graffiti all over the shop fronts.
He says it's a good idea to have the cameras but only if they are going to stop people tagging and vandalising the area, proof of which he is yet to see.

Texting is causing repetitive stress injuries
description.content:
Malisa Meresman can't seem to get away from her Blackberry.
"I'm on my Blackberry almost all day, because for work I use my Blackberry. At night I'm texting my friends. My boss will even text me in the evenings," she said.
Then one day, her thumb started to hurt.
"It's very achy. It gets stiff. And it actually does hurt to text," she said.
It turns out Malisa had a repetitive stress injury caused by frequent texting.
"And our hands sit there with the cell phone kind of cradled and that we have to flex or bend the thumb or index finger to such a extreme that that repetitive motion over time gives problems to some of those joints," said Dr. Kevin Plancher.
Dr. Plancher says these symptoms can lead to bigger problems in the future.
"Repetitive injuries, one, are painful for many patients, and the other is they can develop over time arthritic conditions," he said.
So what's a frequent texter to do? Experts suggest slowing down, taking frequent breaks, and switching up the way you hold your phone or the fingers you use to type with.
"You can also exercise. You can stretch out your thumbs, you can stretch out your index fingers. You can take that break because they're usually in cramped position. And being in a cramped position can give you spasms to those areas," said Dr. Plancher.
And consider talking instead of typing.
"If my daughter approached me and said her hands were sore, her fingers were hurting because she was texting so much I would say text less frequently. Talk to your friends," said Leon S. Benson, MD., American Academy of Orthopedic Surgeons.
Experts also suggest limiting your child's handheld video game use, which requires the same kind of repetitive movements.
A recent study by Virgin Mobile found 3.8 million Brits complained of injuries connected to text messages.

description.hltext_display: Banking with Hanmi Bank
description.content: The Hanmi Bank was founded in 1982 to better serve the Korean- American community. Their philosophy is to meet their customers' needs and growth with them as time progresses.This bank has many services including Bank Rates that are available online. Among these service is their regular checking account that gives the account holder 1% cash back from their net transactions on their debt card. This account requires a minimum $100 to open a minimum balance of $500 to earn the cash back per statement cycle.As far as their online banking services go they offer a wide selection that is also available at your local branch office. This includes the checking of your balances and transactional history. The online statements are also available for your convenience in a safe and secure manner.The Hanmi bank offers CDs with terms from 7 days to 3 years with a minimum deposit of $1,000. The interest is accredited to each account on a monthly basis.The highest earning checking account is the Mega Checking account that requires a minimum deposit of $10,000 which must be maintained to earn the interest on the balance. There is a limit of 100 transactions with this account pre billing cycle.This is a full service financial institution that offers their customers not only deposit accounts but also auto loans, mortgages and credit cards. They also handle insurance, investments and retirement plans to help serve the needs of their growing customer base in Southern California.For reasons of security and safety of your information only a limited amount will be collected. The employees at the Hanmi bank will also be limited to who can access this information and none of it will ever be sold to any third party.This is what you can expect from Hanmi Bank of Southern California.We strive to bring you the latest and most accurate data possible from the home sites of the financial institutions we name. VMware ESXi Update Installer SFCB Authentication Lets Remote Users Gain Access
description.content:
Description: A vulnerability was reported in the VMware ESXi Update Installer. A remote user can gain access to the target system.
When the ESXi 4.1 installer upgrades an ESXi 3.5 or ESXi 4.0 host to ESXi 4.1, the SFCB authentication may allow a remote user to login with arbitrary usernames and passwords. Systems where the SFCB configuration file '/etc/sfcb/sfcb.cfg' was modified prior to the upgrade and where the sfcbd daemon is running are affected.

description.hltext_display: Watch for General Dynamics to Potentially Pullback after Gaining 0.30% Yesterday (GD)
description.content:
General Dynamics (NYSE:GD) traded in a range yesterday that spanned from a low of $70.01 to a high of $70.72. Yesterday, the shares gained 0.30%, which took the trading range above the 3-day high of $70.50 on volume of 1.1 million shares. Often times after large one-day gains, short term traders will seek to take profits and, as such, investors should be cautious.
Shares of General Dynamics are currently trading above their 50-day moving average (MA) of $66.96 and above their 200-day MA of $66.80. Look for the MA to provide support for a short-term pullback in the shares.

description.hltext_display: Saudi Electricity eyes more private participation
description.content:
Saudi Electricity Co (SEC) may involve private firms in building more power plants to feed big consumers such as state oil giant Saudi Aramco, SEC's chief executive said on Tuesday.
State-controlled SEC plans to invest $80bn to boost capacity to at least 70,000 megawatts by 2020 from an installed capacity of 50,000 MW now to meet domestic demand rising at 8 percent annually.
The private sector would contribute through independent power producers (IPPs), investing $24bn of the total $80bn, Abdullah al-Hussayen, Saudi minister of water and power, said in October.
SEC plans to build six IPPs to add 10,000 MW by 2017 with investments of $12bn, SEC's CEO Ali Saleh Al Barrak told Reuters on the sidelines of a company event.
"This is what we have today in our plan and we are revising it every 2 years and probably we may add some more power plants," Barrak said.
"We have in mind, in discussion now a number of power plants which will be for new consumers, probably one of them will be in Rabigh - a new one which is not on the list -- but this is for specific customers, there are big consumers they need high capacity 500 MW-600 MW," he said.
Barrak said SEC was looking to serve big consumers which would need extra capacity by bringing in private investors to build power plants.
"We invest in it with the private sector and we sell power to industrial consumers, some of them like PetroRabigh and Saudi Aramco and others," he said.
Aramco generates 1,063 MW of power and 4.4 million pounds of steam per hour from four facilities. It has expected its power demand to grow to 3,600 MW by 2010.
The state oil firm plans to expand the capacity at the four facilities and add new facilities at two more sites by setting up a power firm.
SEC has now projects under construction to add 7,000 MW of capacity in the next two years, Barrak told reporters on the sidelines of the same event.

description.hltext_display: Sideshow: LiLo probed in rehab assault
description.author: Tirdad Derakhshani
description.content:
Disney sweetie turned Hollywood ingenue Lindsay Lohan in legal trouble? Say it ain't so! LiLo, 24, who has only two weeks left in her court-ordered sojourn at the Betty Ford Center in Rancho Mirage, Calif., may find herself behind bars. Police say the Parent Trap star is being investigated for allegedly assaulting an unnamed female employee at the rehab.
TMZ says the Dec. 12 incident was sparked when the employee chided LiLo for returning late after spending the night at a local bar. The employee says she was attacked when she insisted LiLo take a drug and alcohol test. No arrests have been made.
TMZ says LiLo and her roommates recently were reprimanded for having a drunken party ("the booze was flowing") at one of the rehab's satellite houses.
LiLo was sent to rehab by Los Angeles Superior Court Judge Elden S. Fox, who has vowed to send the Mean Girls star to jail if she messes up while on probation.Tinseltown's biggest moneymakers Leonardo DiCaprio had a titanic year, landing atop Forbes' annual list of highest-grossing actors. Leo starred in Shutter Island and Inception, which made a combined $1.1 billion at the box office. (Leo will make more than $50 mil for Inception alone.) Second place belongs to Mia Wasikowska, who played the title role in Alice in Wonderland. It drew $1 billion. Her second flick this year, The Kids Are All Right, made $29 mil. Alice costar Johnny Depp, whose other 2010 piece was The Tourist, is at No. 3.
Love conquers all . . . "They swore I was the guy who would never" marry, Bret Michaels tells People.
They were wrong: The rocker proposed to his gf of 16 years, Kristi Gibson, Monday night on his VH1 reality show. "It feels awesome," says Bret. 'Dallas' without J.R.!? Here's a deep existential question: Would Dallas be Dallas if it didn't star Larry Hagman as that much beloved spiritual guru J.R. Ewing? That grotesque scenario seemed close to becoming a reality last week, when news spread that TNT had failed to sign Hagman for its Dallas redux.
Don't believe the rumors, says TV Guide mag. Hagman sure doesn't: "I hadn't heard about that, huh!" the 79-year-old TV legend tells TV Guide when told of the rumors.
Negotiations, TV Guide says, are still on.
He's a dreamy vamp, all right Have you spent sleepless nights gnashing your teeth and wondering whether Kristen Stewart is getting her money's worth when it comes to romance?
Fear not, says Christina Ricci, who costars with Kristen's bf, Robert Pattinson, in Bel Ami. RoPa, Ricci tells Rachael Ray, is a "good kisser." Lest you get the wrong impression, Ricci quickly adds, "he's a lovely human being also. . . . He's just, like, a silly, fun guy. We laughed a lot. He makes fun of himself all the time. He's adorable." Finally, I can sleep soundly.
Get ready for Queen Kate . . . Queen Elizabeth II, 84, has the ultimate wedding gift for her grandson Prince William: her throne. So claims Christopher Anderson's megahyped bodice-ripper William and Kate: A Royal Love Story, published Tuesday.
Anderson cites Anonymous Insider, who says the queen is considering giving up the British throne to her son Prince Charles, 62, after William marries his sweetie, Kate Middleton. William would then be next in line. (He and his wife would be King William V and Queen Catherine.)
The Biz in ShowBiz Julie Taymor's $65 mil Broadway musical, Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark, suffered its fourth accident Monday when an actor identified by Anonymous Sources as Christopher Tierney was taken to a hospital after falling 30 feet during an aerial stunt. No comments from producers.
Paul Reubens, 58, is back on top! And back on TV. HBO on Tuesday announced that next month it will film performances of Reubens' hit stage show, The Pee-wee Herman Show on Broadway, for a special to air later in the year. The show, which features John Moody and Drew Powell, is based in part on Reubens' fab children's show, Pee-wee's Playhouse.
Al Pacino's Shylock won't be forced to leave Broadway on Jan. 9 as previously announced. Variety says the Public Theater's staging of the Bard's The Merchant of Venice has done so well it will return for an extended run Feb. 1 to 20.
Variety also says Billy Zane and Jack Huston have signed to costar with Sienna Miller and Danny Huston in Bernard Rose's next pic, Two Jacks. The pic, about a Hollywood tycoon and his family, is loosely (I'll say!) adapted from Leo Tolstoy's story "Two Hussars." Larry King: I have loved three people Larry King may be done with his CNN chat show, but he's definitely not done with love.
The famously bespectacled, suspender-sporting lothario, who has been married eight times (take that, Henry VIII!), told Erica Hill Tuesday on CBS's The Early Show that he loved only three of his wives. "I think in my life I have loved three people. Married all three," Larry said. "The other marriages, I wasn't in love. It was the thing to do, but in love - really in love - three people: current one and two others." The current one would be Shawn Southwick, whom Larry wed in '97, and whom he was set to divorce this summer. They've since reconciled. "There was a big difference in our ages that might have had something to do with it," says Larry, who at 77 is 26 years older. "But I'm not an expert on marriage." Today's other legal briefs The Savannah Morning News says Food Network celeb chef Paula Deen's housekeeper, one Mary Alice White, has been sentenced to 18 months in prison for stealing jewelry from Deen's Georgia home.
Police are investigating the reported theft of $192,000 in jewelry and luggage from Jermaine Jackson's Calabasas, Calif., home. Jackson noticed the items were missing after returning home from vacation.
Paris Hilton may have come face-to-face, cheek-to-cheek, even nose-to-nose with a potential terrorist! (Or not.) Paris tweets that she and her beauteous beau Cy Waits were among passengers evacuated off a Maui-bound plane at LAX on Tuesday when "they found a big knife on board the plane." Adds Paris, "Scary that it got on plane." This article contains information from Inquirer wire services and websites. Contact "SideShow" at sideshow@phillynews.com.

Population growth means potash growth
description.content:
!-- @page } P } -- Unfortunately for BHP, the Canadian government—which must authorize takeovers valued at $299 million and above—blocked the deal, citing "a lack of net benefits to Canada". But the story certainly isn't over, because potash fertilizer is becoming an increasingly high-stakes industry as the world's human population pushes seven billion.
Analysts expect global demand for potash to grow by about 5 percent a year, because potash—a naturally-occurring compound containing the alkali metal potassium—is vital to the world's agricultural industries, which must constantly increase yields to feed a human population currently growing at approximately 75 million per year.
The world's primary potash deposits are found in the ancient sea beds of Canada, Russia and Belarus, but there are potash projects to be found around the world. Here's a look at some major potash producers.
Calgary-based Agrium Inc. (TSE: AGU) shares are currently $82.54, with a 52-week range of $51.39 to $91.25. Agrium stock is currently off its high because of the general decline that followed the failure of the BHP Potash Corp bid, as well as Agrium's acquisition of AWB Limited, which will be completed on December 3.
On the heels of BHP Billiton's thwarted takeover bid, Regina-based Potash Corp. of Saskatchewan (TSX: POT) announced a US$2 billion share buyback program last week. Shares are currently $145.50 with a 52-week range of $88.68 to $160.65 (its high during the Potash bid.)
Earlier this week Brazil-based Amazon Mining Holding Plc. (TSX: AMZ), released promising early test results from its exploratory drilling at its Apatita Phosphate project, next door to its Cerrado Verde Potash mine in Brazil. More drilling has been ordered to complete the testing. Amazon stock is currently $3.85 a share with a 52-week range of $0.93 to $4.19.
German firm K+S AG (DAX: XETRA) is the biggest potash producer in Europe, and is currently seeking to expand its operations via partnerships or takeovers as its current mines are nearing their production capacities. Shares are currently EUR51.99 with a 52-week range of EUR35.55 to 53.20.

description.hltext_display: Penny Stock Prophet Picks Review - Penny Stock Prophet Scam?
description.content:
Edit Article | Posted: Dec 22, 2010 |Comments: 0 |
Share
Many people dream of becoming millionaires. Lots of people have tried to become wealthy trading in Penny Stocks. Not many become millionaires, though not for a lack of trying. It is more the result of not having the right tools, education or skill sets. People who succeed in Penny Stocks are usually very lucky or have the experience and background to read the stocks.
James Connelly A.K.A "The Penny Stock Prophet" was a college student majoring in mathematics, when he stumbled upon the secret to making an ABSOLUTE FORTUNE IN THE STOCK MARKET... Starting with an initial investment of just $1000, James is going to show you how it's possible to reach millionaire status in only 38 trades!
The Penny Stock Prophet developed a successful algorithm to identify the potential of individual stocks on the OTCBB. He used it to become wealthy through buying and selling stocks on the OTCBB. He is offering people the opportunity to take advantage of his algorithms predictions. It is a simple solution, become a Penny Stock Prophet member and let the algorithm do the work to find what stocks to buy. Each member gets daily stock alerts and updates on the stock the Penny Stock Prophet is trading. The alerts include the recommended buy and sell points for individual stocks. The Prophet is the first to say his algorithm is not a 100% perfect for each and every single stock recommendation. Overall thought it is proven to be extremely accurate and successful at predicting the movements of stocks.
The publishers of this system even stand by their product enough to offer a 60 day full money back guarantee if you are dissatisfied with your results on any level. Once you have the system, you don't even have to risk or invest a penny of your own money to confirm its effectiveness first hand as you can simply review the emailed stock pick recommendations and compare them to the real market data as it unfolds in real time, thus making this penny stock picker entirely risk free.

description.hltext_display: Talisman Energy Set to Possibly Pullback after Yesterday's Rally of 0.60% (TLM)
description.content:
Talisman Energy (NYSE:TLM) traded in a range yesterday that spanned from a low of $21.26 to a high of $21.72. Yesterday, the shares gained 0.60%, which took the trading range above the 3-day high of $21.62 on volume of 3.5 million shares. Often times after large one-day gains, short term traders will seek to take profits and, as such, investors should be cautious.
Shares of Talisman Energy are currently trading above their 50-day moving average (MA) of $19.21 and above their 200-day MA of $17.42. Look for the MA to provide support for a short-term pullback in the shares.
SmarTrend currently has shares of Talisman Energy in an Uptrend and issued the Uptrend alert on September 30, 2010 at $17.42. The stock has risen 23.9% since the Uptrend alert was issued.
SmarTrend expects the share price to pullback toward the $21.62 support level. Afterwards, we expect it to move upward with its peers in the SmarTrend Independent Oil & Gas industry.
Keywords: talisman energy trading range stock news

description.hltext_display: French tell Google to pay for the Internet
description.author: Nick Farrell
description.content:
The French , who gave the world America , have asked Google to pay for the internet in return.
After centuries of not collecting on their propping up of the US terrorist overthrow of their popular King, the French have decided to call in their debt.
The cunning plan is to make sure that Google, and other providers of Web content pay for French telecom networks.
A French Minister claims that Google isn't contributing enough to the costs of telecom networks and may be subject to new proposals mandating payments, a French minister said.
According to the Times of India the French government Eric Besson told reporters in Paris today that it seemed unfair that the glorious French taxpayer should pay for the Internet when those who ate hamburgers in a US Googleplex did not stump up any cash.
After all, the French invented the Internet, the Wheel, and a brilliant method of eating invertebrates and amphibians which no one else in the world had attempted before. So it is time that these American upstarts started paying tribute to all things French.
Besson plans to convene a working group including Internet companies with "the objective that services that occupy the largest part of French networks to contribute to their deployment and maintenance.
Europe's largest telecom operators have apparently been twisting the minister's arm lately because they are miffed that they have to invest heavily in networks to cope with the growth of services like Google YouTube .
France Telecom Chief Executive Officer Stephane Richard, Telefonica SA CEO Cesar Alierta and Telecom Italia SpA CEO Franco Bernabe have all said Internet companies are getting an unfair deal from their networks.
Besson said that these nasty foreign countries don't pay any tax in France, and occupy at the same time rule the French market. He said that their bottom lines were bulging due to the investments of operators, the Times of India reports.
Things seem to be getting harder for Google in France lately - it might be time for the Google resistance to start blowing up bridges.
